text: Harry Gulkin (November 14, 1927 â€“ July 23, 2018) was a Canadian director, screenwriter and producer. He was born in Montreal, Quebec. He produced Lies My Father Told Me, which was nominated for an Academy Award for best screenplay, and won a Golden Globe for best foreign movie. From 1983 to 1987, Gulkin was director of the Saidye Bronfman Centre for the Arts.
